title: (x) "Branco" brush script - Wichita/Marker Felt {Tim/Bert}
content:
Hi.

I know I’ve seen this font before but can’t remember where. Plus I don’t know the name.

Could someone please help me?  
I need this one to complete a job.

Thank’s

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [sample.jpg](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=sample_6.jpg) | 59.44 KB |
author: jrsilva

comments.content:
Nope.  
It’s similar but it isn’t Dom, unfortunely.

I think that it is [Wichita](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111041718/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itfprimegraphics/wichita/) expanded slightly  
Tim
I think this could be Marker Felt Wide, slightly stretched (that’s an Apple systemfont).

…and the winner is timd !!!

Yes it is Wichita. Just what I was looking for.  
Thank you very much. You saved my day :)

I’m with Bert. I think the original font this was based on is Marker Felt Wide, designed in 1992 by Pat Snyder (samples [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111041718/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script06Pg24.html) in the Script Font ID Guide). Bert’s sample has all the same earmarks, and it’s a free font. Wichita was designed in 1994 according to [Identifont’s information](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111041718/http:/www.identifont.com/show?DJ0).

So if anything, there are two ‘winners’. Take your pick.

- Mike Yanega

You’e right bowfinpw.  
I didn’t noticed the “Wide” version. I think it may do the job as well.
